title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 6 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: a coroner has recorded a verdict of accidental death into a man who fell 14 floors trying to stop a friend from jumping from a window .
a private school pupil was hospitalised after students broke a curfew and bought drugs and alcohol on a field trip to tenerife .
bodies found at farmhouse : police investigation continues as deaths deemed 'murder and suicide ' .
couple who gave up jobs to look after four children under a court order are angry their financial support is being cut .
'seven-hundred-and-fifty hens for slaughter ' in devon and cornwall .
plymouth argyle hope to cause a shock at premier league side liverpool on sunday .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: saracens 13-13 exeter
text: saracens 13-13 exeter

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon & cornwall for today , we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday with all the reaction to plymouth argyle 's fa cup battle with liverpool and the rest of the day 's news , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss bbc spotlight at 18:30 and the late bulletin at 22:30 tonight .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: chiefs in final repeat
text: the exeter chiefs face second placed saracens in the aviva premiership tomorrow in a repeat of last season 's final .
back-to-back victories have helped to lift the chiefs to third in the table .
coach rob baxter has made several changes to the side that beat bath last week .
carl rimmer , luke cowan-dickie and greg holmes form a new front-row .
in the second row ollie atkins joins geoff parling and fellow england international tom johnson starts at open side flanker
henry slade starts at centre with james short on the wing .
you can hear commentary on the whole of that match on bbc radio devon 95.8fm in plymouth and west devon , across the county on fm and dab digital radio and via the bbc sport website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council looking to extend sky lantern ban
text: cornwall council is looking to gather evidence so it can extend a ban on sky lanterns and balloons being released .
last year the authority banned it happening from council owned and managed land .
it now wants to enforce the ban from all public open spaces but needs statistics to do so .
it is asking people to contact them if any are found .
it also needs proof they are having a `` detrimental effect on the quality of life of those in the locality '' .
the council says they can cause `` unnecessary damage to the environment and wildlife , as well as having financial implications '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: elderly woman waited three hours for ambulance
text: the ambulance service has confirmed it took nearly three hours for an ambulance to arrive in tintagel when an elderly woman fell from her mobility scooter .
the 82-year-old woman was expected to have surgery on a suspected broken leg today .
the south western ambulance service said the first call went in at 10:56 gmt on wednesday , and the ambulance arrived at 13:51 gmt .
two first responders initially attended and administered first aid , while neighbours took duvets and blankets to keep her warm .
a paramedic arrived at 12:48 gmt , and was able to give some pain relief .

a spokesman for the ambulance service said : `` we only have a finite number of resources available to respond to the ongoing rise in demand for our service and we must prioritise those in a life-threatening time-critical emergency situation . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: truro school pupils 'bought cannabis and cocaine '
text: truro school confirms pupils bought cannabis and cocaine after breaking their curfew and sneaking out of a hotel during a school trip to tenerife , according to a report in cornwall live .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: rooney extends torquay united stay
text: torquay united have extended the loan spell of millwall 's paul rooney for another month .
the 19-year-old defender has impressed since joining last month , making three appearances for the national league club .
rooney made his first league start on monday in the 5-5 draw at forest green rovers .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: police warning for argyle fans travelling to liverpool
text: it 's fa cup third-round weekend with plymouth argyle hoping to cause a shock at premier league side liverpool on sunday .
more than 8,000 pilgrims ' supporters are expected to make the trip to anfield - the last time argyle made round three was three years ago , when they played port vale .

documents.title: royal devon and exeter opens extra beds in response to surge in demand
text: the royal devon and exeter hospital has opened an extra 50 inpatient beds this week following an increase in its alert status to level 3 - the third highest level out of four .
the hospital has cancelled all routine elective operations .
a spokesman for the hospital said : `` its not an easy decision to make cancellations , the hospital 's main priority is safety . ''
author: Clare Woodling
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: woman , 82 , waited three hours for ambulance on pavement
text: an elderly woman who broke her leg when she fell from her mobility scooter had to wait nearly three hours on the pavement for an ambulance to arrive .
the 82-year-old fell onto the pavement in tintagel on wednesday morning , according to mary dyer who lives opposite and went to help .
she said : `` i took blankets and duvets to her as it was so cold i was worried she 'd catch pneumonia . ''

a spokesman for south western ambulance service said : `` we only have a finite number of resources available to respond and we must prioritise those in a life-threatening time-critical emergency situation . ''
the woman was taken to hospital in truro where she was expected to have surgery today .

documents.title: six jamie 's italian restaurants to close : industry is 'tough market '
text: celebrity chef jamie oliver is closing six of his 42 uk jamie 's italian restaurants , including the one in exeter .
the move will affect 120 staff nationwide , whom the company said it would try to place in other parts of the chain .
chief executive simon blagden said : `` as every restaurant owner knows , this is a tough market and , post-brexit , the pressures and unknowns have made it even harder . ''
he said each restaurant in the chain needed to attract 3,000 diners a week to be profitable .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: aer lingus regional announce new route from newquay to cork
text: another new route from cornwall airport newquay has been announced as aer lingus regional reveals plans to provide a twice-weekly service to cork airport from may 6 .
author: Falmouth Packet

documents.title: 'he would do anything to help ' says mum of son who tried to stop friend 's suicide bid
text: `` tommy would do anything to help someone in trouble . ''
that 's the plymouth mother of tommy bennett , who died trying to stop a suicidal friend from jumping from a 14th floor window ledge in honolulu in 2015 .
`` he was very dedicated to his friends , '' said lesley heard , 51 .

`` it was a very heroic thing to do and he had succeeded in speaking to the young man but the window frame broke , '' she said after the inquest in plymouth in which a verdict of accidental death was recorded .
`` he was fun loving , impulsive , he was a lovely character . ''
she said tommy and the unnamed friend had been at a party at the university of honolulu when tragedy struck .
his friend survived , but had serious injuries .
`` they were good friends , '' said mrs heard .
`` it was a tragic accident . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire causes 'severe damage ' to devon property
text: fire crews have tackled a blaze which caused `` severe damage '' to a property in kellaton , devon .
firefighters had to remove roof tiles to access the fire and hot spots at the property earlier today .
the annex , and ground and first floor ceilings of the main building were damaged .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said the blaze was thought to have been started accidentally .

documents.title: win your way to the fa cup final # peoplescup
text: sign up to the fa people 's cup and you could win your way on to the hallowed wembley stadium turf at half-time during the fa cup final .
entries are now open and you can find out all the details here .

documents.title: 'seven-hundred-and-fifty hens for slaughter ' in devon and cornwall
text: a devon-based charity says it has been forced to let 12,000 hens nationally go to slaughter due to the threat of bird flu .
the british hen welfare trust says 750 of these would have been re-homed in devon and cornwall .
the group works by taking commercial laying hens that are 18 months old and finding homes for them .
defra currently has an avian influenza prevention zone in place until 28 february .
this requires all hens to be kept indoors and makes poulty gatherings illegal .
as a result , rehoming events at rose ash and south zeal in devon and redruth in cornwall have been cancelled .
author: Simon Alexander
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: ambulance service sees rise in demand
text: an ambulance service sees a rise in demand compared to last year .
the south western ambulance service nhs foundation trust said it was called to 7 % more incidents yesterday than on the same day last year .
the royal cornwall hospital in truro is currently at 'level 4 ' alert , which means it is struggling to cope with demand .
derriford hospital is currently at 'level 3 ' alert .

documents.title: cornish village to lose post office
text: another cornish village will lose its post office later today despite a two-year fight to keep it open .
for the last four months stithians post office has been trading out of a converted public toilet block .
the post office claims that there has been insufficient trade to justify it staying open , but many locals are angry with the decision .
in a statement a post office spokesman apologised for the inconvenience caused to the community and said it was looking at alternative ways to provide services to stithians .
author: Dick Straughan
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: derriford hospital downgrades alert level
text: on plymouth hospitals nhs trust facebook page the chief nurse and operating officer , professor greg dix said :
`` yesterday we declared the highest operation pressures escalation level ( opel status 4 ) .
thanks to a fantastic response from staff within the trust and our community partners , i am pleased to inform you that the trust has de-escalated to opel status 3 .

`` at opel status 3 , we remain operationally challenged and we will continue to assess patients and facilitate discharge to create capacity for the upcoming weekend and have additional medical and senior nursing cover in place to support this .
`` thank you to everyone who contributed to returning the hospital to a more manageable level , whilst maintaining the safety and care of our patients . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: 'tommy gave up his life for friend '
text: a mother says she has forgiven a man whose suicide attempt led to the death of her son .
tommy bennett , died in honolulu after a friend went on to a 14th floor ledge saying he was going to killing himself , an inquest heard .

his mother , lesley heard , from plymouth , said : `` because obviously he [ tommy 's friend ] took a lot of blame because he was the reason tommy died , i wanted him to know he was forgiven and i did not hold anything against him .
`` being a mum , my heart went out to him too .
`` i did n't want his life to be full of regrets for what had happened .
i want tommy 's legacy to be that he gave up his life for his friend . ''
mr bennett was born and brought up in reading and he moved to hawaii , where he worked as a landscaper .
a verdict of accidental death was recorded at an inquest in plymouth .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: hospital sorry for cancelled op
text: a mother from cornwall has spoken out against derriford hospital after it cancelled her daughter 's ankle operation five hours before she was due to have it .
sophie trenoweth , from st day , said it was unfair on her 12-year-old daughter aliyah .
plymouth hospitals nhs trust has apologised for the cancellation .
operations have been cancelled because of huge demand on services .
last night the trust confirmed derriford was on the highest level of alert , 'level 4 ' .
it means hospital services are unable to cope with demand .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: tintagel pensioner who fell from scooter said to lay in gutter for 3 hours before paramedics arrived
text: a pensioner who fell from her mobility scooter in tintagel was lying in a gutter for three hours while waiting for an ambulance to arrive , it has been claimed .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: mother forgives suicide bid man whose son died trying to save him
text: a mother says she has forgiven a man whose suicide attempt led to the death of her son .
tommy bennett , died in honolulu after a friend went on to a 14th floor ledge saying he was going to killing himself , an inquest heard .
tommy died after a window gave way as both walked back to safety .
his friend , who has not been named , survived the fall in august 2015 .
tommys mother lesley heard , 51 , from plymouth , said after the inquest : `` i felt it was important for my recovery and his that we spoke .
`` we have messaged each other several times but i felt it was really important to tell him that i knew it was an accident , that he was under great pressure at the time and i did n't blame him .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: learning to read at 86
text: an 86-year-old woman is learning to read .
ursula shepherd said her teachers in the 1930s `` did n't really care '' if she was educated .
mrs shepherd is learning to read in exeter with the help of tutors from learn devon and has already `` improved a lot '' .
author: Patrick Clahane
Inside Out South West

documents.title: arson suspected for two cornwall fires
text: fire crews in cornwall attended two incidents overnight they suspect were caused by arson .
the first was at 01:28 when a crew from tolvaddon were called to a wheelie bin fire on trenance road in camborne .
at 04:22 a bodmin crew went to lucknow road where they found two cars on fire .
in both cases the fire service suspects arson was the cause and have told devon and cornwall police .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: breaking'noble ' man died stopping friend 's suicide
text: a coroner has recorded a verdict of accidental death into a man who fell 14 floors trying to stop a friend from jumping from a window .
thomas bennett , 24 , whose mother lives in plymouth , tried to save the life of a 19-year-old in honolulu where he was living .
the teenage friend was on a 14th storey window ledge at the university of hawaii , the inquest in plymouth heard .
both men fell but mr bennett , who was born and brought up in reading , died of `` multiple traumas '' while the 19-year-old survived the incident with serious injuries .
coroner ian arrow called mr bennett a `` brave and noble man '' and recorded a verdict of accidental death .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: member of public stepped in to stop attack on youths - police appeal
text: police are appealing to find a member of the public who stopped an assault on two youths in south devon .
the attack happened outside mccolls in kingsbridge on january 2 .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: accidents in st columb and penryn
text: accidents in st columb and penryn
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: seal pups released back into the wild
text: six grey seal pups have been released back into the wild after spending several months being nursed back to health by staff at the cornish seal sanctuary at gweek .
among the six were honey badger , panther , grizzly bear and platypus .
all were rescued around cornwall 's coast after being found abandoned , dangerously underweight and in several cases injured during the autumn .

documents.title: proposed cuts could be 'devastating ' for torbay
text: senior nhs leaders in south devon have written to the mayor of torbay , warning that a proposed £ 1m cut in the public health budget will be `` devastating '' and `` counterproductive '' .
torbay was one of the first areas in the country where the local authority joined forces with the nhs to provide some forms of healthcare .
now the chairman and chief executive of torbay hospital says the work will be damaged if the money is withdrawn .
services that could be affected include health visitors , school nurses , smoking and weight loss services , and services which help people with drug and drink problems .
the mayor of torbay , who 's put the proposal forward , has declined to comment .
author: Sophie Pierce
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: 'i collected tokens to join liverpool '
text: 'i collected tokens to join liverpool '
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: royal cornwall hospital remains at highest level
text: the royal cornwall hospitals trust remains on the highest level of alert today .
it declared it was at 'level 4 ' - formerly known as 'black alert ' - on wednesday .
it means the trust is struggling to cope with demand .
the hospital website shows there is currently up to a 70-minute wait in the emergency department .
bosses said they expected the alert to remain over the weekend .
care quality commissioners have been carrying out an unannounced inspection of the trust over the last two days .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: jamie oliver closes six jamie 's italian uk restaurants
text: celebrity chef jamie oliver is closing six of his 42 uk jamie 's italian restaurants .
the aberdeen , cheltenham , exeter , tunbridge wells and in london , the ludgate and richmond outlets are all scheduled to close soon .
the move will affect 120 staff , whom the company said it would try to place in other parts of the chain .
the company said that the market was `` tough '' and the uncertainties caused by brexit had intensified the pressures .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: police appeal after doorman assault
text: police in plymouth are appealing for information after a doorman was assaulted outside a nightclub .
the man was injured while working outside revolution between 23:55 on 20 november and 00:10 the next morning .
a 21-year-old man from plymouth was arrested on sus of attempted gbh with intent and has been bailed until 1 march 2017 .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: staff from beacon school in bodmin taken to hospital and children evacuated due to fumes
text: two members of staff at beacon infant and nursery school in bodmin were taken to hospital yesterday after inhaling fumes from a failed back-up battery system .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: latest travel : road blocked near summercourt
text: latest travel : road blocked near summercourt
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: names to be added to war memorial
text: saltash town council has agreed to pay for the names of two firefighters to be added to a war memorial in the town .
a local campaign has been trying to get the names of bernard jasper and leslie tibbs added to the st stephen 's war memorial .
the council had previously voted against adding the names .
the two men were among a group of six firefighters who died in the plymouth blitz .
following a meeting last night councillors agreed to apply to the truro diocese to have their names added , and said they would pay for the work .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: seals set for big release
text: it 's a big day today for four young cornish grey seals as they will be released back into the wild after being rescued at the end of last year .
the pups were all found abandoned , underweight and in some cases injured .
they 've spent the last few months being cared for by staff at the cornish seal sanctuary at gweek .
the seals have been named honey badger , panther , grizzly bear and platypus .
author: Dick Straughan
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: school trip pupils buy drugs from tenerife dealer : 'firm and fair action taken to punish students '
text: a private school pupil was hospitalised after students broke a curfew and bought drugs and alcohol on a field trip to tenerife .
the head teacher of truro school , in cornwall , confirmed `` a number '' of sixth form students bought `` a small amount of drugs '' from `` a local dealer '' .

in a letter to parents , head teacher , andrew gordon-brown said : `` i need to let you know about an unfortunate incident that took place during the sixth form geology field trip to tenerife at the very end of last term .
`` the incident involved a number of students breaking curfew to go out to a local bar .
for a small number of students matters were made considerably worse when a small amount of drugs were bought from a local dealer .
`` the teachers who oversaw the trip are to be commended for the excellent care that they provided the students and for investigating the misdemeanours quickly and thoroughly . ''
the head teacher said : `` i have taken firm , fair and proportionate action to punish the offending students .
i have spoken to the parents of all of those involved and am very grateful for the support they have given me in dealing appropriately with this difficult issue .
`` please be assured that i will continue to take a very hard line when it comes to drugs and their impact on our school community . ''
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: cloudy with light rain later
text: it 'll start mild and mainly cloudy .
cloud will thicken from the northwest during the morning followed by patchy light rain and drizzle from lunchtime .
maximum temperature : 11 deg c ( 52 deg f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: torquay get lathrope and young boosts
text: torquay united midfielders damon lathrope and luke young could return to action before the end of january .
the pair have been expected to miss much of the rest of the season after lathrope underwent groin surgery and young injured knee ligaments .
`` with a little bit of luck with both of them , we may well see them before the end of the month , '' gulls boss kevin nicholson told bbc sport .
`` it 's surprising for me and it changes a bit about how i plan going forward . ''
nicholson continued : `` ( torquay physio ) gareth law 's been doing great , they 've been working very hard .
they 've got themselves in position now where they 're slowly getting integrated into training with non-contact stuff and ball work . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: ex-royal marine starts handing out his own parking tickets to neighbours
text: a former royal marine is so fed up with how his neighbours in plymouth are parking that he 's started to dish out his own 'penalty tickets ' and has even painted his own road markings in a bitter dispute in his street .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: ptsd royal marine completes first stage of island challenge
text: a former royal marine who 's recovering from post-traumatic stress disorder has completed the first stage of a challenge to cross the world 's five largest islands unaided .
louis nethercott , 27 , from wiltshire , was medically discharged from 42 commando in bickleigh , devon , last year after struggling to cope with seeing his colleagues killed in afghanistan .
alongside another former marine , anthony lambert , the pair are back in the uk after completing a gruelling trek across borneo .
louis , who grew up in bristol , has four more islands to go .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: special guardians in cornwall angry to lose funding
text: a couple from cornwall who were advised to give up their jobs to look after four children under a court order say they 're angry their financial support is being cut .
daniel and giselle stoddern , from stenalees near st austell , are losing more than £ 50 a week from cornwall council .
the council insists the cuts are necessary because the bill for its special guardian scheme has almost trebled to nearly £ 3m a year since 2011 .
it gives people full parenting rights while not breaking all ties with the children 's biological mother or father .
author: Denis Nightingale
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: school trip student hospitalised after taking drugs
text: a private school pupil was hospitalised after students broke a curfew and bought drugs and alcohol on a field trip to tenerife .
the head teacher of truro school , in cornwall , confirmed `` a number '' of sixth form students bought `` a small amount of drugs '' from `` a local dealer '' .
a school spokesperson confirmed that `` nobody was very seriously ill '' and `` one female student was taken to hospital '' .
they added the student was released from hospital after two hours `` to go back to the hotel and keep well hydrated '' .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: falmouth branch line : delays possible
text: earlier a fault with the barriers at a level crossing between falmouth docks and truro meant trains could not run between these stations .
engineers have fixed the problem , but delays are still possible .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: disruption to water supply in mid cornwall
text: disruption to water supply in mid cornwall
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: derriford hospital on highest alert
text: derriford hospital is on 'level 4 ' alert , formerly known as black alert .
the plymouth hospitals nhs trust declared itself as being on the highest level alert last night .
it means services are unable to cope with demand .
the trust said patients can also help : `` most people who come to hospital , need to be here .
but occasionally , patients do come to our emergency department that could be seen and treated elsewhere .
please make yourself aware of services that you can access . ''
author: Alison Johns, BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: bodies found at farmhouse : police investigation continues
text: a police investigation will continue today after two bodies - one of a man and one of a woman - were found at a farmhouse near dunkeswell in devon .
forensic teams have been at the property and searches have been carried out .
devon and cornwall police said they were treating the deaths as a `` domestic-related murder and suicide '' .
the married couple have been named locally as nicola and michael beck .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online
